supportDesc.condition: The front board is missing; the original sewing is for the most part missing. Many fols. are missing and some are misplaced. Fol. 145 is in reversed position. The bottom right corner of the fols. is damaged by rodents. Many fols. are affected by humidity and stained with dirt; some parts of text are illegible (e.g., fol. 140r, 146r). Some fols. are loosely held together by threads or cords (e.g., s. fols. 113v-114r).

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handNote.seg: Black; red (vivid red; brilliant vermillion for the name of the commissioner).

handDesc.handNote: The handwriting is characterized by tall, thick, slightly right-sloping letters, with rounded and curved shapes. It is uncertain if more hands were involved in the writing (s. e.g., fols. 88v and 89r, 89v and 90r).
- ጵ has the 6th order marker set up on the vertical stroke at the top, oriented to the left (e.g., fol. 58vb l.16)
- መ (esp. in the 1st and 2nd orders) has the loops not completely separated, of triangular shape; the right loop does not rest on the ruled line
- the upper horizontal strokes of some letters (e.g., መ ሠ ወ) are usually slanted to the left
- ሎ has the loop marking the 7th order usually attached directly to the body of the letter, without the horizontal stroke
- the numerals are usually without dashes
- ፮ has the loop open, looking like “compressed” ፯ (e.g., fol. 119rb)
- ፪ has angular and not separated loops (e.g., fol. 12rb)
- ፬ is triangular, downwards-oriented (e.g., fol. 108vb l.8)
- the crux ansata and coronis (together) are used in the Ms. in the margins of some texts, marking the beginnings (s., e.g., fol. 108v)
- sentence dividers are accompanied by paragraph signs.

decoDesc.decoNote: Fols. 7vb, 10va, 14ra, 27rb, 109vb, 120rb, 145ra, 147rb (incipit of Texts I-2, I-3, I-5, I-6, I-22; I-26, I-32, I-34): coloured (red, yellow, green or only red), ornamental band, with decorations on the top extending to the upper margin of the page; interlaces.

Fols. 55rab, 74rab (incipit page of Texts I-13, I-18): elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, green), ornamental band with three pendants, two at the left and right bottom corners and one at the central bottom part, all reaching the bottom of the text, and decorations on the top of the band extending to the upper margin of the page; interlaces.

Fols. 95ra, 113va, 125ra, 136vb (incipit of Texts I-20, I-24, I-28, I-1): coloured (red, yellow, green), ornamental band with four short pendants at corners reaching some lines of the text below and above; interlaces.

Fol. 97rab (incipit page of Text I-21): elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, green), ornamental band with three pendants, two at the left and right bottom corners and one at the central bottom part, all reaching the middle of the text, and decorations on the top of the band extending to the upper margin of the page; interlaces.
